intro: Anemia phyllitidis var. pluripinnae, commonly known as the feather moss, is a variant of the Anemia phyllitidis species, which belongs to the family Hypnaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate forests. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and its ability to form extensive mats on the forest floor. Its leaves are usually narrow, elongated, and have a feathery appearance, contributing to its common name. This variant is notable for its adaptability to acidic soils and its role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its habitat.
